subject: Law
title: Expectation Damages
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Expectation Damages.

hook.text: A supplier breaches and you lose $50,000 in profits. The court orders them to pay exactly that amount.

buildup.text: Expectation damages put the injured party in the position they'd be in if the contract was performed.

discovery.text: They include lost profits, cost of replacement, and any additional expenses caused by the breach.

twist.text: But you must mitigate: if you could have found a cheaper substitute and didn't, your damages are reduced.

climax.text: Hadley v. Baxendale limits damages to those foreseeable at the time of contracting. Surprise losses don't count.

punchline.text: The goal is to make you wholeâ€”not to punish the breacher.

quiz.question: What do expectation damages aim to do?
options: Put the injured party where they'd be if the contract was performed
Return both parties to pre-contract status
